intro: Chaetobromus involucratus subsp. dregeanus, commonly known as the Cape dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy leaves, which help it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its subspecies status highlights its distinct adaptations to specific ecological niches.
